articles.headline: Dylann Roof, Addressing Court, Offers No Apology or Explanation for Massacre
articles.snippet: He insisted that he didn’t have a mental illness as he spoke during the sentencing phase of his trial over the killings at a church in Charleston, S.C.
articles.abstract: He insisted that he didn’t have a mental illness as he spoke during the sentencing phase of his trial over the killings at a church in Charleston, S.C.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHARLESTON, S.C. — Seeming to abdicate one of his last chances to save his own life, the convicted killer Dylann S. Roof stood on Wednesday before the jurors who will decide his fate and offered no apology, no explanation and no remorse for massacring nine black churchgoers during a Bible study session in June 2015.
articles.byline: By Alan Blinder and Kevin Sack

articles.headline: Senate Republicans Open Fight Over Obama Health Law
articles.snippet: President Obama made a rare trip to Capitol Hill to defend the Affordable Care Act, as the Republican-led Congress took the first step toward undoing significant parts of it.
articles.abstract: President Obama made a rare trip to Capitol Hill to defend the Affordable Care Act, as the Republican-led Congress took the first step toward undoing significant parts of it.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Congress opened for battle over the Affordable Care Act on Wednesday as Republicans pushed immediately forward to repeal the health care law and President Obama made a rare trip to Capitol Hill to defend it.
articles.byline: By Thomas Kaplan and Glenn Thrush

articles.headline: Mexicans Are the Nafta Winners? It’s News to Them
articles.snippet: Donald J. Trump likes to say the trade pact has helped Mexico at the expense of American workers. But for many Mexicans, life is the same struggle as ever.
articles.abstract: Donald J. Trump likes to say the trade pact has helped Mexico at the expense of American workers. But for many Mexicans, life is the same struggle as ever.
articles.lead_paragraph: APODACA, Mexico — In 30 years at Whirlpool, working at the company’s manufacturing plant in this industrial Mexican town, José Luis Rico has witnessed some pretty major changes.
articles.byline: By Azam Ahmed and Elisabeth Malkin

articles.headline: Fed Officials See Faster Economic Growth Under Trump, but No Boom
articles.snippet: Minutes of its December meeting offer more evidence that the central bank sees itself as a counterweight to campaign promises on tax cuts and spending.
articles.abstract: Minutes of its December meeting offer more evidence that the central bank sees itself as a counterweight to campaign promises on tax cuts and spending.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Federal Reserve officials expect Donald J. Trump’s election to result in somewhat faster economic growth over the next several years, but they see little chance of the boom Mr. Trump has promised, according to an account of the Fed’s most recent meeting in mid-December.

articles.headline: Apple Removes New York Times Apps From Its Store in China
articles.snippet: The technology giant said it was complying with a request from Chinese authorities. Apps from other international publications were still available.
articles.abstract: The technology giant said it was complying with a request from Chinese authorities. Apps from other international publications were still available.
articles.lead_paragraph: Apple, complying with what it said was a request from Chinese authorities, removed news apps created by The New York Times from its app store in China late last month.
articles.byline: By Katie Benner and Sui-Lee Wee

articles.headline: Record 2016 for U.S. Auto Industry; Long Road Back May Be at End
articles.snippet: A total of 17.55 million vehicles were sold, but struggling passenger car sales, reliance on sales incentives, and a new administration raise questions.
articles.abstract: A total of 17.55 million vehicles were sold, but struggling passenger car sales, reliance on sales incentives, and a new administration raise questions.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Unexpectedly strong sales of new vehicles in the United States in December propelled the industry to another record figure in 2016: 17.55 million sold.

articles.headline: Trump and Julian Assange, an Unlikely Pair, Unite to Sow Hacking Doubts
articles.snippet: Mr. Trump used comments by Mr. Assange, the WikiLeaks founder long reviled by many Republicans, to buttress his questioning of the conclusion that Russia was at fault.
articles.abstract: Mr. Trump used comments by Mr. Assange, the WikiLeaks founder long reviled by many Republicans, to buttress his questioning of the conclusion that Russia was at fault.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just a year ago, they might have seemed the oddest of couples. But now President-elect Donald J. Trump and Julian Assange, the WikiLeaks founder, have formed a united front against the conclusion of American intelligence agencies that Russian intelligence used hacked emails to interfere in the presidential election.

articles.headline: Republicans’ 4-Step Plan to Repeal the Affordable Care Act
articles.snippet: Though much remains unclear, a determined Republican president and Congress can gut President Obama’s signature accomplishment.
articles.abstract: Though much remains unclear, a determined Republican president and Congress can gut President Obama’s signature accomplishment.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Vice President-elect Mike Pence and the top Republicans in Congress made clear on Wednesday, more powerfully and explicitly than ever, that they are dead serious about repealing the Affordable Care Act.

articles.headline: Falcons, Drones, Data: A Winery Battles Climate Change
articles.snippet: Jackson Family Wines is among California winemakers employing both high-tech and old-school techniques to adapt to hotter, drier conditions.
articles.abstract: Jackson Family Wines is among California winemakers employing both high-tech and old-school techniques to adapt to hotter, drier conditions.
articles.lead_paragraph: On a misty autumn morning in Sonoma County, Calif., Katie Jackson headed into the vineyards to assess the harvest. It was late in the season, and an army of field workers was rushing to pick the grapes before the first rains, however faint, began falling.

articles.headline: Megyn Kelly Being Replaced by Tucker Carlson at Fox
articles.snippet: Mr. Carlson’s selection is a swift conclusion to an anchor sweepstakes that emerged only on Tuesday, when Ms. Kelly announced that she would be leaving for NBC News.
articles.abstract: Mr. Carlson’s selection is a swift conclusion to an anchor sweepstakes that emerged only on Tuesday, when Ms. Kelly announced that she would be leaving for NBC News.
articles.lead_paragraph: Tucker Carlson, the veteran cable television host and conservative writer, will succeed Megyn Kelly in the coveted 9 p.m. slot on Fox News, solidifying the network’s right-wing identity in prime time as it prepares to cover the administration of President-elect Donald J. Trump.
